description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects that number of trunk ports has exceeded the specification limit.

event.Summary: Number of trunk ports exceeded specification limit ($v1)

description: The max number of the Eth-Trunk port.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxTrunkNum

description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects that the number of trunk ports has resumed below 95% of the specification limit.

event.Summary: Number of trunk ports threshold alarm cleared

description: The max number of the Eth-Trunk port.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxTrunkNum

description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects that the number of PortVlan has exceeded the specification limit.

event.Summary: Number of port vlan exceeded specification limit ($v2)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstPVNumExceeded ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxPVNum i 9999

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The max number of the Port-Vlan.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxPVNum

description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects that the number of PortVlan has resumed below 95% of the specification limit.

event.Summary: Number of port vlan threshold alarm cleared

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstPVNumResumed ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxPVNum i 9999

description: The textual name of the physical entity. The value of this
object should be the name of the component as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name (e.g., `console') or a simple component number (e.g.
port or module number, such as `1'), depending on the
physical component naming syntax of the device.
If there is no local name, or if this object is otherwise
not applicable, then this object contains a zero-length
string.
Note that the value of entPhysicalName for two physical
entities will be the same in the event that the console
interface does not distinguish between them, e.g., slot-1
and the card in slot-1.
variables.name: ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName

description: The max number of the Port-Vlan.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxPVNum

description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects that the number of VLANs running VBST has exceeded the specification limit.

event.Summary: Number of VLANs running VBST exceeded specification limit ($v1)

description: The max number of VLANs running VBST.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxVlanNum

description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects that the number of VLANs running VBST has resumed below 95% of the specification limit.

event.Summary: Number of VLANs running VBST threshold alarm cleared

description: The max number of VLANs running VBST.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxVlanNum

description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects that the number of VLANs that cannot be calculated in the VBST packets received by interface exceeds the threshold.

event.Summary: VBST packets received by interface exceeded the threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstInvalidPV HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstVlanNum i 9999 HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstTrapPort s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstTrapVlan s EXAMPLE

description: Number of VLANs that cannot be calculated in the VBST packets received by interface.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstVlanNum

description: Interfaces where the VBST packets containing the VLANs that cannot be calculated are received.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstTrapPort

description: Number of VLAN lists that cannot be calculated in the VBST packets received by interface.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstTrapVlan

description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects that the number of VLANs on all Eth-Trunks exceeds the limit of VBST.

event.Summary: VLANs count on all ethernet trunks exceeded limit of VBST

description: Number of Eth-Trunk Port VLANs with VBST enabled.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxTrunkPVNum

description: Trap message is generated by VBST node when
it detects the number of VLANs on all Eth-Trunks falls below the limit of VBST.

event.Summary: Number of VLANs on all Eth-Trunks threshold alarm cleared

description: Number of Eth-Trunk Port VLANs with VBST enabled.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstMaxTrunkPVNum

description: In VBST mode, the Eth-Trunk configuration conflicts with the remote observing port configuration.

Summary.eval: ($v1 ne '') ? '$v1' : 'Eth-Trunk configuration conflicted with remote observing port configuration'

description: The specific cause of the configuration conflict with the remote observing port configuration.
variables.name: HUAWEI-VBST-MIB::hwVbstConflictDescription
